item.title: Auto Updating RS2 Client - Yay?
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Krichevskoy:

You’re editing GASM output?

This was an early revision and something we used to do. Not anymore however. It also meant you had to run the script each time rs updated, to get the client to connect. = Fugly.

item.title: Auto Updating RS2 Client - Yay?
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Ollie…WTF? You have modified our ARGA “fix client” that we used to use lol…? Its nothing we mind but you could have at least given credit?

Yours

import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;
/**
* Fixes The Client to load When Run.
*/

public class FixClient{
	
	public static void main(String[] args){
		
		new FixClient();
	}
	
	public FixClient(){
		
		File out;
		PrintStream outprint;
		BufferedReader inread;
		
		try{
			out = new File("clientout.j");
			out.createNewFile();
			outprint = new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream(out));
			inread = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(new File("client.j")));
			
		} catch (Exception e){
		        System.out.println(e);
			System.out.println("\n\nIO Error");
			return;
		}
		
		String curline;
		boolean inmain = false;
		boolean locals = false;
		boolean cb = true;
		
		try{
			while ((curline = inread.readLine())!= null){
				if (inmain){
					if (curline.indexOf("locals") != -1) locals = true; 
					if ((curline.indexOf("TAG") != -1) && locals ){
						outprint.println(curline);
						outprint.println("\tgoto TAG_0");
						inmain = false;
						cb = false;
					} else outprint.println(curline);
				} else if (curline.indexOf("main") != -1){
					inmain = cb;
					outprint.println(curline);
				} else if (curline.indexOf("getLocalHost") != -1){
				        outprint.println("\tldc_w \"po4.runescape.com\"");
					/*outprint.println("\taload_0");
					System.out.println("Added: \taload_0");
        				outprint.println("\ticonst_5");
        				System.out.println("Added: \ticonst_5");
       					outprint.println("\taaload");
       					System.out.println("Added: \taaload");	*/
        			        outprint.println("\tinvokestatic java.net.InetAddress java.net.InetAddress.getByName(java.lang.String)");
				//System.out.println("Changed: \tinvokestatic java.net.InetAddress java.net.InetAddress.getByName(java.lang.String)");
				} else outprint.println(curline);
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println("Da foo?!");
			System.out.println(e);
		}
	}
}

Ours :

import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;
public class FixClient{
	public static void main(String[] args){
		new FixClient();
	}
	public FixClient(){
		File out;
		PrintStream outprint;
		BufferedReader inread;
		try{
			out = new File("clientout.j");
			out.createNewFile();
			outprint = new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream(out));
			inread = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(new File("client.j")));
		} catch (Exception e){
			System.out.println("IO Error");
			return;
		}
		String curline;
		boolean inmain = false;
		boolean locals = false;
		boolean cb = true;
		try{
			while ((curline = inread.readLine())!= null){
				if (inmain){
					if (curline.indexOf("locals") != -1) locals = true; 
					if ((curline.indexOf("TAG") != -1) && locals ){
						outprint.println(curline);
						outprint.println("\tgoto TAG_0");
						inmain = false;
						cb = false;
					} else outprint.println(curline);
				} else if (curline.indexOf("main") != -1){
					inmain = cb;
					outprint.println(curline);
				} else if (curline.indexOf("getLocalHost") != -1){
					outprint.println("\taload_0");
        				outprint.println("\ticonst_5");
       					outprint.println("\taaload");
        				outprint.println("\tinvokestatic java.net.InetAddress java.net.InetAddress.getByName(java.lang.String)");
				} else outprint.println(curline);
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println("Da foo?!");
			System.out.println(e);
		}
	}
}

wtf?

Read full topic
